Caption: Figure 8. Examples of face and brain surfaces under gaussian noise with different σ set to 0.0 and 2.0 mm, re- spectively.
Mention:
The second experiment tests the robustness of conformal
geometric maps in the presence of noise. We add gaus-
sian noise(N (0, σ)) on each vertex of the face and brain
surfaces. σ increases from 0.0 mm to 2.0 mm while the
window size for computing the curvatures of 3D face and
brain surfaces is 10.5 mm. Example surfaces with noise
under two different σ are shown in Fig. 8. We match the
various noisy surfaces to the original noise-free surface and
the average matching results of the face and brain surfaces
are shown in Fig. 9 for various σ values. From the results
